*Collected Works of Master Zhang Sanfeng, Volume Four*

**Recompiled by Li Xiyue of Changyishan in Hanjia**
**Respectfully inscribed by Zhang Daoyuan, styled Zishi**
**Published by Zhu Daosheng, styled Wanchengzi of Langzhong**
**Collated by nephew Ying Chuncheng and Zhu Zan, styled Suyuan**
**Proofread by son Huang Panxi**

**Mysterious Essentials, Volume One**
**Two Imitations of the Ancient, with Self-Annotations**

*Imitating the Ancient* (after the *Cantong Qi*) states: *"I dare not speak idly, but emulate the writings of the ancients."* The title is taken from this.

The primordial ancestral qi,
Vague and dim, profound and still.
Originally formless, without trace,
At first a nameless, undivided whole.
When chaos first split open,
Taiyi sprouted forth in bud.
The Two Modes joined in virtue,
Sun and moon waxed and waned in light.
Qian intermingled with Kun’s transformations,
Kun sought Qian’s completion.
Different names yet one in origin,
A single root from which all springs.
Within and without, void and solid,
Hard and soft held in balance.
Yin and yang harmonized in governance,
Transforming and dividing into forms.
True essence, true qi,
Flickering and elusive in the void.
Kan and Li inverted,
The Five Phases set in motion.
When the *Jiji* gives birth to spirit,
The *Weiji* brings death’s approach.
The Dao of immortals is guarded with care,
The ghostly path inclines toward perversion.
Those who seek the Heavenly Dao
Swiftly shun the gates of ghosts.
From immortals aspiring to Heaven,
The Dao and qi endure forever.

**Again:**

The great Dao of Heaven and Earth,
Embraces harmony and holds the center.
The profoundest of the profound,
The subtlest of the subtle—its source.
Profound and subtle interpenetrate,
Splitting open the vast primeval mist.
The aperture’s bellows and key,
The Vermilion Bird scorches the sky.
The metal trigram’s moon appears,
In the southwest, a companion is found.
Laughing, they pour the dark wine,
Feasting within the Yellow Center.
The two eights achieve perfection,
Raven and hare blend as one.
The spirit’s radiance, silent and still,
The Yellow Elder within the imperial chamber.
The Xun wind stirs and blows,
The cauldron brims with crimson clouds.
Water and fire advance and retreat,
Dawn as *Zhun*, dusk as *Meng*.
Midnight and noon in motion,
Dawn and dusk yield no effect.
When the tenth month’s count is full,
The hexagrams’ images reverse and end.
The work of destiny complete,
Pure yang qi surges forth.
The subtle workings of spirit,
The Dao’s methods boundless.

These two chapters are commonly conflated into a single piece in popular editions, titled *"General Discussion on Internal and External Fire Timing in Golden Elixir"*—a practice I privately dispute. Later, upon obtaining Wang Xianzang’s edition, I felt a sudden clarity.

**The Heaven-Climbing Ladder**
A wanderer of the Great Yuan, drifting far,
Beard bristling like a halberd’s edge.
A single tune ascends the ladder to heaven,
Worth more than a flying staff of tin.
Recalling the first days of seeking the Dao,
My heart stood firm as unturned stone.
I resigned my post, roamed seas and peaks,
Toiling in search of the elixir’s secrets.
I bade farewell to my parents’ graves,
Leaving my homeland behind.
Parted from my middle-aged wife,
Stepping out as dawn broke white.
Abandoned my young children,
Turning from the burning house.
What others find hardest to complete,
This traveler has done.
What others find hardest to sever,
This traveler has cut away.
To witness the fruit of eternal life,
Soaring aloft on a crane’s back.
Postnatal nurturing strengthens,
Feet outpace the toil of service.
My heart stirs with longing,
As fleeting years slip like a galloping colt.
I crane my neck toward Zhongnan Mountain,
Sighing thrice to the heavens.
Heaven sent the Fire Dragon Master,
Whose deep, resonant voice—bold and measured—
Composed an ancient song, *"Reading the Moon."*
I pondered each word.
Knowing my inner elixir was formed,
I did not dwell on foundational work.
He bestowed upon me the outer elixir’s skill,
With earnest, tender instruction.
Refining the self, I forgot worldly cares,
Gathering the medicine in due season.
The prenatal has no weight,
The fire timing no hexagrams or strategies.
Only distinguish old from young,
Merely discern civil from martial.
Seek purely with true intent,
The *daogui* defies detailed explanation.
For ten months, embrace the primordial embryo,
For nine years, face the wall in meditation.
Exchange the cauldron to beget a new generation,
Ride the dragon to summon thunder.
Heaven and earth decay in time,
But the immortal elder’s life knows no end.

**The Master’s Oral Transmission**
The sacred master’s oral secrets,
A formula bequeathed through ages.
Passed to the people of this world,
How many truly comprehend?
A torn robe is mended with cloth,
A withered tree is nurtured with soil.
What can mend a person’s decay?
The mechanism of yin and yang’s creation.
Take the elixir from within *Kan*,
A golden flower blooms, one branch revealed.
Auspicious clouds unfold at heaven’s edge,
Propitious light fills the grave’s void.
Returning, I am dim and silent,
Like one drunk, like one entranced.
The great elixir, small as a millet grain,
Sheds its husk to dwell in effortless non-doing.
Roaming freely through heaven and earth’s expanse,
The myriad forms become a pearl in the palm.
If one can ingest this medicine,
Lifespan aligns with heaven and earth.
Should it fail to extend life,
My words are all falsehood.

**Reply to Emperor Yongle**
Heaven’s mechanism is not lightly disclosed,
Lest the present age lack ferocity.
Through a thousand trials, ten thousand hardships,
I now transmit it to the pulse of heaven and earth.
The emperor sought me to inquire of the golden elixir,
The patriarch left behind the secret of eternal life.
What is the secret of eternal life?
When Dao is full and virtue abundant, it is the true plan.
Curb desires, settle the mind, calm the spirit’s cares—
The immortal’s arts hold no other skill.

Below this is a five-character verse:
*"The golden elixir weighs one *jin*,
Close your eyes, silently preserve the spirit.
It is taken from within your home,
Why labor to seek it outside?
Refine the *Li* maiden’s mercury,
Swallow the *Kan* man’s essence whole.
Golden elixir and fire timing—
Each word is the primordial sound."*
This was written by Ancestor Lü,
Presented in reply to Emperor Yongle.

**Song of the Dao’s Sentiment**
The Dao’s sentiment is no ordinary feeling,
Once you grasp heaven’s mechanism, do not treat it lightly.
First, lay down all worldly concerns,
Then delve deeply into the principles.
Before refining the returning elixir, refine your nature,
Before cultivating the great medicine, cultivate your heart.
When the heart is cultivated, the elixir’s sign naturally arrives,
When the nature is purified, the medicinal materials naturally grow.
When medicinal materials grow, redouble your efforts,
Thunder rumbles faintly, shaking the empty void.
Where lightning flashes, seek the true seed,
When the wind’s signal comes, find the root source.
A myriad rays of rosy light envelop the golden cauldron,
A thousand *zhang* of purple clouds shroud heaven’s gate.
If you reach this point, do not be startled or afraid,
Steadily guard the cavern’s gate with your primordial spirit.
Like a cat seizing a mouse, a hare meeting a hawk,
Hasten your efforts, redouble your diligence.
All myriad phenomena are not of this kind—
A single speck of red light is the utmost truth.
This red light is the breath of spring,
Within it, as if dust on a bright window.
Suspended is a speck of prenatal medicine,
Distant as a grape, near as gold.
At this point, rely entirely on caution,
The slightest thought arising loses the celestial truth.
Wait for that speck to submit of itself,
Within your body, it transforms into the four seasons’ spring.
A wisp of white cloud, a waft of fragrance,
Each rain’s passing brings renewal.
All day, languid as a drunkard,
Patiently awaiting the cavern’s spring.
The body’s yin essence is entirely stripped away,
Transformed into a lump of pure yang gold.
At this moment, breath ceases like a minor death,
Forged into a single piece—complete truth.
Only then is the work accomplished,
Then return to the dusty world to accumulate merit.
When merit is full and work complete, heaven’s decree arrives,
The yang spirit emerges, the true numen revealed.
These words must not be spoken to the unworthy,
Do not lightly discuss them with those who do not understand.
Within them lies the profound principle of penetrating the mysterious—
Beyond this truth, there is no truth.
Gather your belongings, seal them firmly,
One day, upon success, they may affirm your heart.
Affirm your heart—
Fifty-two lines for you to seek.
Should there be falsehood, heaven’s punishment will strike,
Speaking to the unworthy invites the lash that destroys the body!

**Song of Refining Lead**
Who understands the method of refining lead?
Attain this, and you become a true immortal.
I lamented my old age, finding no path,
Roaming the five lakes and three isles.
At sixty-seven, I entered Zhongnan,
Meeting a true person who transmitted the supreme treasure.
True lead arises before heaven and earth,
No need for metals, stones, plants, or herbs.
Refine it through eighty-one cycles, and if the work is complete,
Within the profound darkness, golden treasure is born.
A single golden bone stirs heaven and earth,
The two eights harmonize to generate a beautiful form.
Once the beautiful form is born, it dwells in the earthen cauldron,
You must, thought by thought, seal it firmly.
When the first yang fire arises, nurture it gently,
When the second yang fire arises, there is divine power.
If it reaches the *Tai* hexagram of the three yangs,
A roaring, fierce fire burns the empty void.
Retreat all yin talismans to generate the numinous essence,
Once the numinous essence is born, heaven and earth are complete.
Should there be any deficiency, harmonize again,
Return to the earthen cauldron to generate the numinous essence.

The full count of five thousand four hundred completes its measure,
Only then is the true marvel of refining lead exhausted.
I exhort those of like mind who come after:
Do not regard the refining of lead as easy.

*Song of the Primordial Qi*
Born as the primordial qi of pre-heaven,
It hides within the mountain of form, hard for men to encounter.
I clearly reveal it—you must remember:
A single string of spring water enfolds its configuration.
Draw it from the lower gate and swallow it through the mouth,
The twelve thunder gates all tremble in fear.
Drunk, ah! Drunk, ah! Once more drunk, ah!
The cinnabar field is suffused with spring, red as jade.
Freely drinking the fragrance of the nectar jar,
The wind of Xun stirs the primordial harmonious qi.
Yin demons are vanquished, a spring fills the breast,
Spirits wail and ghosts weep, heaven and earth overturn.
When merit is complete and the work fulfilled to three thousand,
One rides the phoenix and mounts the crane, ascending as an immortal.

*Song of Lead and Fire*
The great medicine arises at its appointed time,
At the *hai* hour, the beginning of *zi*, the fifth watch—hark!
Spirit and essence unite, merging their radiance,
In a state of vague indistinctness, a bright moon is born.
Once the union ceases, it flows downward in a bubbling stream,
The first yang returns—do not lightly release it.
Swiftly seal the Gate of Great Mystery,
Fire drives the medicine past the Weilu acupoint.
At the moment of gathering, use the eyes to guard the Niwan,
Lower the left and raise the right, then pause in stillness.
This is called "gazing at the principle, ascending the brain to the mysterious,"
Then lowering the right and raising it again in alternation.
When the count of six sixes is complete, the medicine matures,
Yang reaches its peak, yin arises, shifting to the right.
One must open the gate to withdraw the fire,
The gaze descends to guard the Kun field.
Right raised, left lowered, just then fixed in place,
The count of two eights completes one celestial cycle.
This is the true fire-phase of nature,
Naturally ascending and descending, spontaneously drawing and adding.

Neither crescent nor full moon, neither dark nor new,
No bathing rites nor lengthy scriptures remain.
Metaphors swept away, names cast aside—
Only these two lines hold the true essence.
*"Left and right"* should be read as *"before and after"*—
Take heed. Recorded by Sanfeng himself.

**Song of Realizing the Dao**
Spirit does not wander outward, essence does not leak,
Qi is not dissipated, the numinous sprout takes root.
The Five Phases and Four Images enter the Central Palace—
Why fear the golden elixir will not form itself?
Within, the true spirit; without, its response appears,
All around, empty blossoms descend like white snow.
At the return of the first yang, the hours of Hai and Zi converge,
Amidst them emerges a perfect full moon.
Hasten to apply effort and skill—
Gold at its fullest luster cannot be plucked.
Breath stirs the fire of the Mysterious Pass,
The azure sky splits, the primordial chaos cracks.
The Yellow River reverses its flow, ascending Kunlun,
The nine orifices and three barriers all open wide.
Transformed into jade nectar, it is swallowed into the belly—
A mute tasting honey, beyond words to tell.
At this stage of practice, be most vigilant,
Gather and bathe in accord with the seasons.
The two grades of yin and yang share the same nature,
Yet their inner and outer fire-tally differ.
The numinous medicine arrives in but a moment,
But its nurturing still requires ten months.
To mature further, pass another three years—
Three threes as nine, the elixir’s face turns away.
With the elixir complete, let out a long cry and depart the mountain,
Manifesting or concealing, leave traces of transformation.
The Celestial Emperor hears the name and sends down a purple writ,
Summoning me to ascend the heavens in azure flight.
Those who later diligently cultivate by this,
Become guests at the assembly of the Three Pure Ones.

**Song of Sitting in Meditation**
At first, when sitting, learn to contemplate Chan—
This subtle message lies in the Mysterious Pass.
Secretly, subtly, regulate the breath,
Within the cauldron, yin and yang refine.
Nature must be awakened, life transmitted—
Do not treat the fire-phase as trivial.
With eyes closed, observe the heart and guard the original destiny,
Purity and non-action are the root.
Within a hundred days, signs appear—
A single point in Kan rises upward.
The Yellow Dame acts as matchmaker,
Infant and maiden unite in perfect roundness.
The beauty is endless—who can it be told to?
The whole body, from head to toe, qi surges to the heavens.
Who knows this subtle message?
A mute dreaming, unable to speak.
Swiftly act, gather the primordial—
A speck of numinous medicine pierces the three barriers.
From the Elixir Field it ascends straight to the Niwan peak,
Descending past the heavy tower to the Great Central Origin.
Water and fire in harmony, true lead and mercury—
Without wu and ji, the elixir will not form.
The heart must die, life must be firm,
The radiance of spirit illuminates the three thousand worlds.
Beneath the shadowless tree, the golden rooster crows,
At midnight, the red lotus appears.
At the winter solstice, the first yang begins its return,
A thunderclap shakes the heavens.
The dragon calls, the tiger rejoices,
Immortal music resounds—no ordinary sound.
In the midst of the indistinct, preserve being and non-being,
Boundless transformations lie within.
Mysterious within the wondrous, wondrous within the mysterious,
The river chariot transports it past the three barriers.
Heaven and earth in harmony, the ten thousand things are born,
Daily drinking sweet dew, sweet as honey.
Immortal is Buddha, Buddha is immortal—
One nature, perfectly luminous, not two kinds.
The Three Teachings were originally one family:
Hungry, eat; tired, sleep.
Falsely burning incense, bowing in Chan—
How could they know the Great Dao lies before their eyes?
Deluded, they fast and miss the chance—
Once the human body is lost, ten thousand kalpas of difficulty follow.
Foolishly chasing the illusory path to the Western Heaven,
A blind man stumbling through the mountains at night.
The subtle mechanism is no trivial matter—
To leak the celestial secret is a crime as heavy as mountains.
Grasp the Four Upright Principles, contemplate with intent,
Break through the Mysterious Pass, wondrously penetrating the mysterious.
From Zi to Wu, Mao to You, the nights are unbroken—
Early seek a bright teacher to congeal the elixir.
One who recognizes true lead and mercury,
Becomes an immortal of ageless life.
Cultivate day by day, each day firm,
Do not view the practice with short-sighted eyes.
After three years and nine months, the work is accomplished,
Refining a single grain of the purple golden elixir.
Who composed this song?
The Immortal Sanfeng of Pure Emptiness.

**Song of the Dao’s Essential Secret**
The Dao’s song, the Dao’s song—
Without knowing the essentials, one is surely beset by demons.
Observe the Mysterious Pass, regulate the true breath—
Knowing these two essentials, cultivation is complete.
With the original spirit, enter the Sea of Qi,
When spirit and qi merge in silence, you attain the true sovereign of the first mystery.
With the original qi, enter the Yellow Court,
When qi and spirit harmonize in obscurity, you attain the most luminous of the second mystery.
One mystery is wondrous, one mystery is the aperture—
With desire, observe the aperture; without desire, observe the wondrous.
These two mysteries are the true mechanism—
Who knows they emerge from the same source under different names?
To observe the Mysterious Pass, there is no other secret—
First, within the aperture, regulate the true breath.
Spirit tranquil, qi still—utterly natural,
The wondrous arises from non-arising, the Supreme Ultimate appears.
The ancient immortals spoke sparingly,
Fearing the leakage of true secrets, they did not speak idly.
Some said it is fixed in the center,
Others said it is unfixed, to be grasped on one’s own.
Now, I speak it all—
It lies between the fixed and the unfixed.
Fixed is called the aperture, unfixed the wondrous—
What Laozi spoke of as "mysterious and again mysterious."
Pointing clearly, I ferry the sentient—
Leaving this for my disciples as a reward.
Those who encounter it but do not cultivate become lesser ghosts,
Whether saint or commoner depends on the person.
At the outset, practice is most difficult—
Departing from distraction, yet still sunk in torpor.
A true scholar, resolute in learning,
Must distinguish spirit and qi as pure and turbid.
The primordial spirit is most clear and luminous,
The postnatal spirit is but turbid matter.
Sweep away the turbid, guard the clear,
Seal the Three Treasures within the numinous valley.
This numinous valley is the aperture—
Within the aperture, regulate the breath with deep reflection.
One breath departs, one breath arrives,
Each breath interdependent, each moment close.
Subtly, silently, unnoticed by others,
Spirit and qi gather, surging through the nine orifices.
Practice thus to attain the aperture’s wondrousness—
Whence could torpor and distraction arise?
**Song of the Great Dao**
Now, lend your ears to my words—
The Dao has the primordial and the postnatal.
The postnatal dregs are of no use,
The primordial speck is called true lead.
To be ignorant of true lead, to lose one’s original nature—
This is the first illness in cultivation.

Within the Jade Clarity Hall, few tread the path—
I now reveal to you the immortal’s realm.
Life must be transmitted, nature must be awakened,
To ascend beyond the mortal lies within your grasp.
In stillness, awaken nature; in motion, gather the elixir—
Within, the tortoise and serpent coil in reverse.
At the stirring of the first yang, commence the work,
Vigorously turn the Celestial Gate.
Yin arises at noon within the yang of Kan,
At Mao and You, proceed with measured calm.
The Dipper’s handle turns the wheel toward the Purple Palace,
Laughing to welcome the guest, Master Yellow.
In the Yellow Dame’s chamber, meet the maiden of cinnabar—
The maiden and the infant naturally pair.
To lay the foundation, refine the self,
Refine it to purity, then clearly gather.
The mentor first guides me through a provisional practice:
First unseal the nine orifices by opening the gates.
The nine orifices originally lie at the Weilu point,
Begin by surging from the Yongquan beneath the feet.
From Yongquan, rise gradually to the knees,
Beneath the knees, the work demands great effort.
The Buddhists call this "reed sprouts,"
Like a crawling insect, like a piercing thorn.
Pass the knees, ascend slowly to Weilu,
Where a hard object seems to resist.
Only then proceed with all higher practices—
The three provisional stages hold their oral secrets.
Once the three passes burst open in a single strike,
Turn the flow upward to the Mud Pill Palace.
Pierce the Golden Lock Pass, descend the Magpie Bridge,
The Twelve-Storied Tower—how wondrous indeed!
The Twelve-Storied Tower is the Crimson Palace,
Within the Crimson Palace lies the Yellow Court, precise and true.
The Yellow Court must be refined to essence,
For within its center dwells a single spark of spirit.
Do not blindly obscure what is hidden—
The Yellow Court is the true Mysterious Pass.
If you fail to recognize the Mysterious Pass in its exact place,
Where will you lodge the true lead once gathered?

Have you not seen the *Awakening to Reality* poem?
"One must rely on the Mysterious Female to establish the root."
When true essence returns, the golden void remains,
A single luminous pearl never parts from you.

Have you not seen the *Book of Concordance*?
Its likeness to Penglai is no false comparison.
"Below is closed, called the supreme closure of non-closure,"
The two apertures’ method requires qi’s mutual dependence.

From now on, when discoursing on the Dao or expounding on profound principles,
All else is but emptiness apart from this.
Once the passes are opened and the work accumulated,
Forging the sword demands discerning the true message.
Though Moye was wrought of iron,
How much truer is my sword, originally straight!
Heaven is the furnace, earth the forge,
Gold and water must balance—never act recklessly.
At Zi and Wu, practice to temper and complete,
To be hard or soft, to take or discard.
When the sword is whole, gather true lead,
Draw from the primordial chaos before separation.
If you gather only postnatal qi,
You merely prolong life, not transcend it.

At the second seven-hour mark, the true mechanism appears—
Seek it within the divine land of the Red Continent.
If both method and resources are obtained,
Reflect carefully to distinguish them well.
Rosy clouds, the hue of a pheasant,
Lips like cinnabar, skin as snow.
Wise and discerning, nature gentle and kind,
Eyes like lacquered pearls, hair pure black.
Qi refined, gaze steady, steps composed—
Only then calculate the years and months within.
Five thousand four hundred births yield the Yellow Path,
In profound obscurity, born of fleeting glimpses.
Follow the time to gather, determining rise and fall,
Not a hair’s breadth may be overstepped.
At this juncture, know the crescent moon’s third day,
The marvel lies in the west, in the white of Geng and Xin.
The sword of wisdom sharp, the heart sincere,
Strike the bamboo to resonate, then pluck the zither.
The Heavenly Ladder is indispensable—
Who can fathom such subtle, hidden mechanisms?
Do not recklessly angle for the giant turtle in the sea’s depths,
Lest you startle it away, never to return.

Guard the furnace without harm, distinguish the timing with care,
After gathering the postnatal, merely extend the years.
One double-hour divides into six watches,
The golden elixir forms within two.
The remaining four watches hold divine work—
The marvel lies in heart-transmission, not to be divulged.

When true lead arrives, ignite the spirit-fire,
From west to east, first seek me.
Move my true mercury, a single red speck,
To welcome and meet, forming one pearl.
Pass the three passes, ascend to the Mud Pill Palace,
Descend the Twelve-Storied Tower into the Broad Cold.
Neither foolish nor wise,
Neither sober nor drunk.
Were it not for expending spirit throughout the body,
How could husband and wife unite as one?

When the elixir is settled, the heart rejoices,
The hexagrams *Tun* and *Meng* respond at dawn and dusk.
Know that bathing lies within,
At Mao and You, do not advance.
Guard the city walls, cease the martial work,
The numinous cinnabar fills the crucible, crimson.
Thus, after ten months, the work is complete,
The vessel, the elixir chamber—all emptied in an instant.

Enter the deep mountains, embrace the One,
All things voided, no effort spent.
Cold, heat, hunger, toil cannot assail,
For nine towering years, face the wall.
From the Northern Sea at dawn to Yingzhou at dusk,
Suddenly, when merit and practice are fulfilled,
The Three Officials of the Water Palace tally the years,
A sealed elixir missive descends from the Jade Heaven.
Green luan and white crane dance in flight,
Until the final investiture in the Illuminated Realm,
Forever becoming an immortal, ageless and undying.

**Song of the True Bellows and Key**
Speak not of the Great Dao as effortless action—
What is this toying with bellows and key in the chamber?
When desire stirs, not a moment’s rest,
Purple qi and red light scatter in brilliance.
The Azure Dragon delights, the White Tiger despises,
The Azure Dragon coils around the tortoise shell.
Two streams of true qi pierce the Heavenly Palace,
Decisively ascending to the Three Clarities Pavilion.
Within the pavilion, a jade pool is clearly seen,
Holding the medicine of immortality.
Follow the time to gather and take it,
Consume it to enjoy Penglai’s bliss.

**Song of the Mysterious Pass**
The Mysterious Pass, a single aperture, holds the true secret,
As Qian and Kun split open, Penglai’s expanse unfolds.
Within the Yellow Court dwells an original elder,
Holding the zither, awaiting the moon at heaven’s edge.
The second water is clear, the third water turbid,
Golden flowers bloom, the Dui trigram’s head wanes.
On Mount Emei, purple mist soars,
The mist transforms, melting the red furnace’s snow.
The dragon’s chant compels, the tiger’s roar presses,
The numinous tortoise drinks the Golden Crow’s blood.
Riding the dragon, sword at the waist, drunk I return home,
Turning the three passes to face the Northern Palace.

**Song of Refining Lead**
The Supreme Dao, proclaimed anew,
Distinguishes the prenatal from the postnatal.
It speaks only of lead born after Gui,
Not of yang arising before Gui.
Rein in the intent-horse, lock the mind-ape,
Without stray thoughts, the mind must be single-minded.

Cut away the three poisons—greed, wrath, and delusion—until they perish,
Root out the five thieves—lust and desire—until they lie hidden no more.
The Flowery Pond’s water, the Upper Valley’s spring,
The ancients used these to moisten the Three Fields.
Should you know the medicine that returns to the root and extends the years,
You must refine the Returned Elixir, the life-renewing lead.
Forth from the Northern Sea, coursing through the Western River,
Wielding the craftsman’s hand, plant the golden lotus.
Capture alive the tiger’s marrow to temper in the furnace,
Seize the living tortoise’s essence to simmer in the cauldron.
Prenatal qi, primordial mist,
A single draught of ghee preserves the countenance.
Once attained, let cold and heat transform as they will,
Consuming it, you leap beyond the gate of life and death.

Seek the first scripture, trace the new moon’s arc,
I now reveal the wondrous within the wondrous.
When water and fire achieve balance in a single union,
Yin and yang converge in three thousand cycles.
Reaching the other shore, no boat is needed,
Extinguish thought, dissolve emotion, sever false ties.
In stillness and clarity, behold the treasure of life,
In dimness and silence, guard the embryonic immortal.
Endure hardship for two or three years,
The yang spirit emerges, sacred work complete.
Tending the fire without mishap, mastering creation,
You live long without aging, your lifespan equal to heaven’s.

**Song of the Golden Elixir**
A single grain of golden elixir weighs one *jin*,
Those who know it attain everlasting life.
Lay the foundation, sweep away worldly affairs,
Refine the self, only to nurture the original spirit.
The Yellow Court’s earthen crucible, the prenatal mercury,
All cares vanish, worldly passions cease.
Departing from the self is not the Dao,
Clinging to the self is also void.

I now disclose the celestial mechanism’s principle,
Revealing it to all heroic seekers of the Dao.
Before your eyes lies the path to longevity,
Yet countless mortals remain deluded about their original nature.
Sweep the spirit-terrace clean of every thought,
In tranquil leisure, enact the mysterious work.
Breathing in emptiness, the spirit guards its abode,
The hundred channels return to the source, clear as water.
Within the body, true lead manifests,
A single crimson radiance, bright as the moon.
The Mysterious Pass comes and goes without fixed place,
Yin and yang ascend and descend in their appointed hours.
Within the year, take from the month; within the month, take from the day,
At mid-autumn, the moon’s orb appears.
For thirty days, remain seated at home,
Never straying from the Purple Tenuity’s star.
Facing south, observe the Northern Dipper’s handle,
Just as noon strikes the third watch.
In the northwest, install the furnace to refine the numinous medicine,
In the southeast, erect the tripod to enact the divine work.
Tripod and furnace face each other, true hands at work,
The wisdom sword hangs in the Crystal Palace.
The Yellow Dame beckons as matchmaker,
The numinous tortoise enters the furnace, ever deeper.
Ghee pours upon the crown, the true bellows’ key,
Gathering the prenatal qi in its purity.
One breath, one twist at the Celestial Valley’s point,
The river chariot transports it up Kunlun’s peak.
Crossing the Magpie Bridge, it enters the Flowery Pond,
Descending the twelve-story tower of the Double Loft.
Passing the tailbone, spine, and the three passes,
The Metal Lord returns to its abode in the Yellow Court.
Lead seeks mercury like a cat hunting a mouse,
Mercury pursues lead as a rabbit flees the hawk.
Nine revolutions of the divine elixir enter the golden tripod,
Ten months of gestation complete the work of creation.
Unaware of cold or heat, true creation unfolds,
The body transforms into pure yang, true gold.
Accumulate three thousand deeds of merit in the world of dust,
Ascend at daylight to pay homage in the Jade Capital.

**Song of the Returned Elixir Breaking Delusion**
The Returned Elixir’s secret, the Returned Elixir’s secret,
I now explain it to you in careful detail.
Three thousand side paths of minor arts,
Apart from this golden elixir, all are crooked ways.
All manner of dross and base matter are of no small account,
Only true yin and true yang are rightly grafted.
When yin and yang unite, lead and mercury join,
Infant and maiden blaze in the empty sky.
Dragon and tiger ascend and descend in spiraling flight,
The numinous tortoise at the sea’s bottom plays with stars and moon.
The long yellow sprout, the flying white snow,
The golden dew in water—this is the prenatal secret.
The true Yellow Dame, the true bellows’ key,
The golden elixir is the medicine of immortality.
First lay the foundation, then introduce the medicine,
A hundred days’ effort firmly grasped.
If you guide the two qi back to the Yellow Path,
The three families meet, the immortal embryo forms.
Refine the nature, join the life,
Do not waste months and years among mortals.
If you return lead and mercury to true earth,
Adding mercury and refining lead, they never perish.
The crow’s eight ounces, the hare’s half-*jin*,
These two enter the village of Wu and Ji.
Martial at both ends, civil in the center,
The four images captured and cooked in one vessel.
Ten months of diligent work, the fire’s timing perfect,
Pure yang refined, life without end.
Transfer the tripod, shift the embryo for three to five years,
Nine years facing the wall, the yang spirit emerges.
Mysterious is the ancestor, the female is the origin,
Prenatal and pre-earth, the root of all things.
Point and open the eye that pierces earth and heaven,
Turn the celestial pivot, the Dipper moves in reverse.
Open the aperture, qi flows of itself,
The thunder revolves the Dipper’s handle, its sound roaring.
Clouds drawn from the sea’s bottom, the dragon churns waves,
Wind stirs in the muddy pellet, the tiger’s roar resounds.
If you master the method of inverting yin and yang,
The creation of heaven and earth is accomplished in an instant.

Expound the *Awakening to Reality*, discuss the *Uniting the Three*,
This principle was originally one and the same.
Though this medicine is obtained from the chamber of love,
The great medicine of the golden elixir is not the same.
Though you refine qi, though you refine essence in vain,
Seal the tailbone, yearn for ascension,
Without the golden elixir, all is futile.
Beasts and birds know how to preserve their horns and antlers,
The tortoise draws breath through its nose to regulate qi,
The deer circulates qi through its tailbone to refine essence.
The crane’s embryo is ever steadfast,
By night it companions clouds and pines, quietly nurturing spirit.
Beasts may live a thousand years,
Yet humans fail to awaken to longevity.
Throughout the world, people covet fame and profit,
Unafraid of Yama’s ledger of sins.
Humans are born and die, beasts perish,
When the three-inch breath severs, ghosts become neighbors.

The prenatal medicine, the postnatal medicine,
These are the true wondrous substances of yin and yang.
The prenatal medicine can transcend,
The postnatal medicine extends the life of the shell.
If mortals grasp the mechanism of grafting,
They attain great enlightenment and never die.
Refine the nature, perfect the life,
Gather the prenatal to plant in the muddy pellet.
The youth refines, essence and qi complete,
In stillness, a single qi can ascend to heaven.
Only the formless body remains unbroken,
This is the Great Luo Immortal of true cultivation.
In youth, original yang is lost,
Midway through life, one leaves home, the nature wild and reckless.
The yang line flees into the yin lines of the Kun trigram,
Transforming into the Li trigram, hollow and stretched.
Take the solid center from the Kan trigram’s position,
Return to the root, revert to yang, restore the original.

True water and fire pair with yin and yang,
Let mortals not indulge in reckless speculation.
Though you sit in emptiness through non-action,
You cannot escape death to be buried in Beimang.

Practicing stillness, guarding the Central Yellow,
To old age, all differences are but vain effort.
Even if you comprehend the true suchness of nature,
The yin po will reincarnate into the realm of ghosts.

The elixir of life, the nectar of returning soul,
The Golden Elixir is the king among medicines.
If you swallow but a single grain into your belly,
You reverse aging, regain youth, and live long.

Neither abandon your wife nor forsake grain,
Hold fast to the fast, expound the Dharma, journey west.
Though you master myriad heterodox methods,
Apart from this same kind, all are but madness.

I have revealed all the celestial mechanisms,
The Returned Elixir is truly the immortal’s recipe.
Generations of immortals hence attain this,
Transcending the mortal world to ascend to heaven.

I exhort later Dao seekers,
Do not heed the false masters’ short and long.
If you obtain the oral formula of the Golden Elixir,
You extend years, abide in the world, and live boundlessly.

By this cultivation, forge the path of longevity,
Repay the master’s kindness, give thanks to heaven.
Hold fast to this formula, make it a vessel of compassion,
When merit is complete and work perfected, move the Jade Emperor.

Who crafted the Golden Liquid to break delusion?
For ten thousand ages, it has flowed through Yuanhua Zhang.

*Dragon-Tiger Returned Elixir: Song of Pointing to Delusion*

Though you inquire everywhere for the immortal’s ladder,
Only at the first stirring of yang does it become wondrous.
Water submerges Kunlun, the azure sea churns,
The tiger’s roar on the cliff is the ancestral foundation.

A direct pointer to the carefree, swift method:
A bright moon illuminates Mount Sumeru.
The tiger in water, the dragon in fire,
Within the Eight Trigrams and Five Phases, they manifest brilliance.

Seize the dragon, and purple mist arises,
Subdue the tiger, and golden flower dew appears.
How do these two images establish the root of the Dao?
Only because the path of Caoxi has long been borrowed.

Male pairs with female, yin pairs with yang,
Their union is a clear battle.
Wu-ji earth serves as the Yellow Chamber,
When spirit and qi are pure, it is the Medicine King.

Refine the grain of Purple Gold Elixir,
Ride the crane, mount the phoenix, and pay homage to the Jade Emperor.

---

The tiger hides in the azure sea, sleeping with the child,
The dragon circles above Fusang in the sunlight.
Wait until the yang of spring stirs,
The tiger emits golden light, the dragon spits saliva.

A sword at the waist gathers the dragon’s mist,
When the dragon returns, the tiger naturally retreats with it.
The two follow each other into wu-ji,
A furnace of true fire slowly simmers.

From midnight to year’s end, the fire timing is strict,
At mao and you, be vigilant, do not idle.
Swallow the ancestral qi, the jade nectar,
Who can fathom the true emptiness within form!

Refinement lies only in the place of one’s birth,
The Ten Kings of the Underworld share this method.
Swiftly awaken, do not be foolishly greedy,
Do not dismiss the old man’s words as heresy.

Though you expound the Three Treasuries’ Dharma,
Without awakening to non-arising, it is all in vain.
Break through this iron steamed bun,
And you shall be carefree and at ease for millions of years.

---

*Annotations on the Nine August Elixir Scripture: Third Month, Generating the Hun Soul—Golden Elixir’s Three Returns, One Reversion Song*

Month by month,
All are the true essence and blood within the young lotus.
No need to set up furnace or tripod,
Only employ non-action to draw it through.

Nor wait for the qi of the two crescents,
Wait only for the star palace between the brows.
Nor wait for eight taels or half a catty as the living child,
Wait only for the exact five thousand four hundred of the proper month.

No need for spirit to commune across bodily separation,
Only use the upward exhale and downward inhale of the two ○.
First, the whole body warms,
Second, the fontanel opens,
Third, the celestial eye opens, and you see the great thousand worlds.
At this point of efficacy, it is truly
The generation of the womb, the birth of the embryo, the arising of the hun soul.

I instruct the Dao-cultivating disciples:
You must ride the crane amidst the clouds,
Never be buried in the sands and dust.

---

*Annotations on the Nine August Elixir Scripture: Fourth Month, Generating the Po Soul—Golden Elixir’s Four Returns, Two Reversions Song*

The Old Ancestor is named the Demon-Quelling Protector of the Dao,
Penetrating the seven po to restrain them at you.
Within you lies true gold,
Gold can preserve longevity.
The imperial true po, the life’s origin,
From this, the wondrous primordial origin arises.

On the wedding night of the bridal chamber,
Forget passion amidst the circumstances.
*Tali, moli, jinzha, muzha, tuonam, om,*
*Like me, like me,*
*Namo prajñāpāramitāye.*

---

*Annotations on the Nine August Elixir Scripture: Seventh Month, Opening the Heart and Seven Orifices—Golden Elixir’s Seven Returns, Five Reversions Song*

The Dao Lord sits in the Great Tenuity,
Descending to give birth to the Great Heavenly Honored One.
Bestowing these true Dharma words,
Guiding people to ascend to Jade Purity.

A single-character formula,
Seven months as its symbolic form.
Two on the left, three on the right, called five,
The Supreme Ultimate is naturally imbued with the five numina.

Only when the five numina attain it do the seven orifices open,
You must move the celestial eye to come here.
Those who truly cultivate the Dao,
Break through the mechanism to ascend the jade terrace.

---

*Annotations on the Nine August Elixir Scripture: Tenth Month, Firmness of Form and Spirit—Golden Elixir’s Ten Returns Song*

The Immortal Girl Nongyu plays her jade flute,
Each note blowing into the primordial orifice.
This orifice is called the root of heaven and earth,
When the prenatal is sufficient, the hundred scenes naturally give birth to spirit.

The eight scenes generate the twenty-four heavens,
The nine orifices naturally open to the numinous.
The sacred embryo originally borrows the true qi,
The Queen Mother of the Jasper Pool floats golden liquid,
The heart of the lotus.

Heart after heart aligns with the yellow sprout,
Fragrance arises within the brocade universe.
Seizing the true fragrance’s wondrous mist,
It preserves me for kalpas, ever abiding.

Ever since the Pure Yang Patriarch revealed this,
Wise men of ten thousand generations have used it with care.
On Penglai Isle, leave your name,
At Yingzhou Assembly, emulate Lord Xu,
In broad daylight, uplift your dwelling and ascend.

Three years today, earnestly exhorting:
May all people possess longevity,
Yang unites with the primordial root.

---

*Song of Securing the Leak*

Speak of the mysterious, discourse on the mysterious,
Move the spirit, turn the nine orifices,
The three passes and eight gates all topple.
Close the Yellow Chamber, refine the elixir furnace,
Do not let the six thieves come to clamor.

The master laughs *ha-ha*,
Guarding the Yellow Court, proud and aloof.
The infant comes, the old woman calls,
The two households unite in wondrous mystery.

The Golden Elixir is cradled in the embrace,
The whole body radiates a haze of light.
Seated in the cinnabar field, called the Pure Void,
Purple qi and red light ever shine.

Ascend to the summit of Mount Sumeru, the Niwan Palace,
Descend to the Yongquan point, penetrating the profound mysteries.
Within the Seven Treasures Pool, steal the treasures away,
Discard all impure essence and杂 qi.

Jade branches and golden blossoms, fresh as new,
Crafted from coral and agate, chariots of carnelian.
Secure the leaking body, seal the leaking orifices,
The unyielding cauldron firmly secures all leaks.
The Twelve-Storied Tower opens wide,
The seven meridians and eight vessels unite with the Triple Burner,
All bones and limbs bear witness to the effect.

The large intestine encircles, the small intestine gleams,
Above and below, the Magpie Bridge stands steady and sure.
Cross the Zhaozhou Bridge to drink tea,
By the Sweet River, listen to voices call.
The great circulation flows, the small circulation arrives,
The three families meet in shared joy.
I fortify this leaking body,
For ten thousand years and a thousand autumns, free from age.

Refine the corporeal form into the Great Yang,
Essence, qi, and spirit complete, guard the Central Yellow.
Lead and mercury simmered into the supreme treasure,
A single grain of Golden Elixir radiates its light.
The Infant manifests, ever-present,
Attaining longevity equal to Heaven, escaping impermanence.

Whoever masters the *Song of Securing the Leak*
Holds the very method for eternal youth.

---

*Song of Realizing the Dao*

A worm in the mundane world,
Drifting through the mortal realm,
All day adrift, with no recourse.
The true apertures, none understand,
Yet once found, the true gate lies therein.

Seek no one’s favor, nor their love,
No one’s disdain, nor their reproach.
No meditation, no prostrations,
No seated practice, no lazy precepts.
Roam the ends of the earth, behold the world,
When wine is met, drink a few cups,
When meat is met, eat a few bites.
Beg a bowl of rice, fill the belly,
Find a scrap of cloth, cover the four great elements.
A broken house? Build it yourself.
The master within must be at peace.

Enter not the arena of fame and gain,
Care not for success or failure,
Owe no taxes to the state,
Incure no debts to children.
If others seek me, I remain unattached.

At dawn, wander by the five lakes,
At dusk, lodge within the green mountains.
A boulder for a pillow,
The blue sky as a blanket.
Tigers and leopards dare not intrude,
Demons and monsters dare not harm.
Unaware, sleep until the sun glows red,
Free from fear, shock, or dread.

From now on, shatter the gate of right and wrong,
Leap free from the red dust beyond.
Clap hands, slap thighs, laugh *he-he*,
At ease, at ease—truly at ease.

---

*Palindrome Poem*

By the bridge, the courtyard faces the willow-lined bay,
In the bright moonlight, half the door stands ajar.
From afar, the crane returns late to the cave,
Quietly strumming the lute, seated with idle clouds.
Seeking fire for the elixir, the stove is never empty,
Gathering herbs for immortality, the mountains are fair.
The gourd hangs high on the tree, the recluse long hidden,
Far from the clamor, the waters murmur softly.

---

*Thirty-Six Poems on the Golden Elixir*

**Nurturing the Dao, Returning to the True**

For decades, adrift on rivers and lakes,
Meeting the master, I bit through the iron steamed bun.
Who prepares the sweetest nectar?
The midnight lamp’s oil may yet suffice!
Trust the Dao—form and spirit enter the wondrous,
Only then know life and nature must be fully cultivated.
Once a glimpse is grasped,
Forget the world’s ten thousand bushels of sorrow.

**Leaving the Dust, Returning to Seclusion**

A heart at leisure, free from worldly dust,
In the realm’s stillness, nurture the spirit.
The plain lute plucks the moon from the sky’s edge,
The dark wine drains the spring from the jar’s depths.
The five qi ascend to the origin with the sun’s growth,
The three flowers gather at the crown, ever renewed.
Refining the great medicine, transcend the ordinary,
Carefully inscribe poems to warn those who follow.

**Sweeping the Realm, Cultivating the Mind**

The inner and outer scenes weave like hemp,
Yet there is ground for boasting in one’s pursuits.
Let go—no delusion, the true shortcut,
Turn back, reflect—this is my home.
The six roots purified, without obstruction,
The five aggregates empty, without blemish.
Utterly forgotten, the heart’s square inch grows still,
A bright moon illuminates the Southern Flower.

**Overcoming the Sleep Demon**

Drowsy qi and slumber bring no light harm,
At the first watch, weariness arises.
There must be something—ever vigilant,
Only the heart must stay sharply awake.
Though the body may seem drunk with thoughts,
Rouse the spirit, sit until dawn.
With this one whip, awaken fiercely—
What endeavor cannot be achieved?

**Seeking the Mysterious Pass I**

A single aperture, the Mysterious Pass, the road’s head,
Neither heart nor kidney, most profound and secluded.
Searching the bladder and perineum is labor in vain,
The spleen, stomach, and Niwan Palace—seek not at random.
The root of spirit and qi ever flickers,
Within the cavern of emptiness, explore carefully.
It turns out to be but the place of numinous clarity,
Nurture the Returned Elixir, ride the crane in flight.

**Seeking the Mysterious Pass II**

The puppet on stage nods its head,
Know that all is pulled by strings.
Though pulled by another’s power,
Who pulls me? Who schemes?
Rely on the master’s constant moonlight,
Ensure every place is graced with fine elegance.
If refining the elixir requires the winter solstice,
Seek it within the stillness of the numinous terrace.

**On the Mysterious Pass in General**

The body itself is Heaven and Earth—seek not without,
The aperture of empty numinosity is most profound.
Two or three may be permitted as companions,
One or four may join as peers.
The five earths build the center, governing growth,
Where the Xun wind rises, hardness and softness are determined.
Once the wondrous return to the origin is known,
Within the six-six palace, spring and autumn recur.

**Forging the Spirit Sword**

The master transmits the method of forging the green serpent,
In the Kun crucible and Qian furnace, it is tempered and refined.
Neither iron nor gold, yet brimming with life and death,
Formless and shadowless, it moves with numinous power.
Drawn from the scabbard, Heaven and Earth grow narrow,
Sheathed in the breast, a mustard seed swells.
Though ten thousand taels of gold cannot find it,
It lurks by the body, slaying demons unseen.

**Postnatal Foundation-Building**

Qi depleted, blood weakened—time to replenish,
The enlightened master imparts the oral formula.
Jade fluid from the Flower Pool, swallow with the hours,
Peach Grove’s nectar, sip with the days.
Abandon thoughts, forget concerns—return to the child’s heart,
Return to the root, restore life—this is the immortal’s work.
The cinnabar field grows warm, the face regains youth,
Mocking those who cling to empty heads white as snow.

**Postnatal Refinement of the Self**

Who knows the work of refining the self?
The essence-spirit ever attends me.
Not a speck of dust stains the heart—utter stillness,
Ten thousand cares forgotten—the nature grows dull.
No thieves of the perverse can invade the inner realm,
The disciple serves the stern master all day.
When hungry, drink the wine of immortality,
Daily drunk, muddled as mud.

**Obtaining the Medicine Through Self-Refinement**

Refinement of the self follows the foundation’s completion,
Ten thousand cares at heart already forgotten.
A wheel of moonlight serves as companion,
The thunder’s roar at midnight known alone.
Snowflakes in stillness scatter white specks,
Sprouts from emptiness grow golden branches.
Seizing the primal yang’s returning essence,
A thousand-year-old crane-rider is conceived.

**Commencing Self-Refinement**

Body apart yet spirit conjoined—the principle is clear,
Two counterparts must align in practice.
Set the furnace, erect the crucible, seek the true seed,
Face the world yet forget emotion, recognize the native land.
Seize the dragon’s head to gather the purple mist,
Split the tiger’s tail to reveal golden light.
A speck of true lead swallowed into the belly,
All things shine bright, life endures long.

**The Primal Crucible**

Once the primordial aperture is discerned,
The crucible of heaven and earth is recognized.
No need for spiritual effort to regulate water and fire,
The numinous qi naturally permeates skin and flesh.
Morning by morning, the yellow crane nests in the golden tripod,
Night by night, the silver toad pours into the jade flask.
To grasp the truth of the golden elixir,
Cultivate where the body has yet to form.

**The Primal True Lead**

The world abounds with those who love the mysterious,
Yet few know this primal lead.
Within five thousand days, the yellow path is born,
In thirty hours, the black lead is recognized.
Not after heaven and earth divided,
But before father and mother conceived.
Such a supreme treasure exists in every household,
Only the foolish fail to see it clearly.

**The Primal Great Medicine**

Believe in the golden elixir—its principle is most refined,
Few understand this primal speck.
It belongs to all, rich or poor,
And grows in every being, wise or foolish.
Swallowed into the belly, it quickens with life,
Held in the palm, it vanishes without form.
If the world asks me, I cannot answer,
But point afar to the moon rising at *geng*.

**Seizing the Primal**

I smile to see the wondrous mystery in the divine land,
Whispered secrets passed ear to ear.
Split open chaos to seek gold and mercury,
Cleave the primordial to grasp the watery lead.
A grain of millet holds the northern sea,
The toad’s light illumines ten thousand paths in the west.
Should one gather and swallow it,
How could a mortal not become immortal?

**Coalescing the Primal**

Once the golden elixir is known, act swiftly,
Its marvel lies in the subtle and minute.
A speck of true lead stirs at the female gate,
The three families’ foundation lies in the mysterious chamber.
Coalescing in the cinnabar field, jade leaves grow,
Returned to the earthen crucible, immortal fungi flourish.
To fathom the primal principle,
Recognize the red flower atop the black turtle.

**Recognizing and Gathering the Medicine**

The sun at sea’s bottom, the moon atop the mountain,
At the assembly on Spirit Mountain, seek the eggplant’s hue.
Flowers bloom, birds sing—spring fills the sky,
Inverted, dragon’s saliva pairs with tiger’s blood.
Divine radiance pierces the jade flask’s field,
The secret tally follows *kun*, *shen*, *zi*, and *wu*.
A hundred days of the knife’s measure—great elixir complete,
Elixir complete, one becomes a dweller of Penglai.

**Direct Indication of True Lead**

True lead is the flower within the moon,
West and north engender each other, one family.
Within the female lies the male—a supreme treasure,
From black emerges white, the numinous sprout appears.
Gold abundant, water scarce—this is precious,
Yin flourishing, yang weak—nothing to boast.
Know too that it contains *wu* earth,
Ever the furnace’s fire stirs cinnabar.

**Direct Indication of True Mercury**

True mercury is the essence within the sun,
East three, south two—white engenders white.
Fire hidden in wood is no idle tale,
The male harbors the female—a precious treasure.
Let not a trace of yin’s impurity taint it,
Ensure the whole body shines with the great yang.
Within it, *ji* earth nurtures the primordial qi,
Refining the numinous sprout to gradual growth.

**Lead and Mercury Conjoined**

True lead and true mercury unite,
Sticky as lacquer, inseparable in intent.
Mercury poured into lead is like bathing the sun,
Lead tempering mercury is like adding oil.
Lead harmonizes mercury’s nature, ever companion,
Mercury delights in lead’s affection, joyfully swimming.
The five phases within and without gather in array,
Forming the red-and-white head of the great elixir.

**The Wondrous Inversion**

Seeking truth and visiting the Dao—what difficulty?
Only that one’s heart must know inversion.
Do not seek the supreme medicine in mountains and forests,
But find true lead within the city.
The green dragon locks *li* and *kan* in embrace,
The white tiger draws *dui* into *qian*.
This art, once set in motion,
Naturally ascends against heaven’s path.

**Harmonizing the Elixir’s Head**

Once the yellow path is born, the sprout begins,
True yang must return in due season.
The samadhi fire issues from *li*,
A thunderclap resounds from *zhen*.
Qi and spirit harmonize to nurture the numinous essence,
Heart and life interdepend to form the sacred embryo.
Once the inner message is grasped,
The three passes and nine apertures open at once.

**The Three Families Meet**

Summon the yellow matron to act as matchmaker,
From nothing, something is nurtured and grown.
Yet it was the serpent girl who waited then,
Luring the young lord from without.
The two apertures communicate without barrier,
The chambers of time and palace meet undivided.
Harmoniously joined, boundless potential,
A child is born—the sacred embryo.

**The Ninefold Great Return**

The ninefold returning elixir begins with practice,
Know that the spring emerges from the mountain’s base.
Set the furnace’s wondrous use upon *kun* earth,
The fire’s work relies on *xun* wind.
*Dui* tiger and *zhen* dragon blend,
*Kan* man and *li* woman harmonize.
Once the four images return to center,
The mechanism of creation rests in my body.

**The Subtlety of Fire Timing**

Years, months, days, hours—gathered in a moment,
A moment’s lapse parts yin and yang.
Withdraw and add according to the hare and rooster’s advent,
The work of ascent and descent—dragon and tiger fierce.
Guard against danger, cease the fire’s work,
Weigh grains and scruples, align with the hexagrams.
Naturally, the count completes the celestial cycle,
Day by day, thus practiced for ten months.

**Spiritual Transformation After Birth**

Elixir complete, my life obeys no heaven,
Mountains and valleys may shift as they will.
Honor and disgrace touch me not—I delight everywhere,
Profit and fame hang not—I follow the moment’s whim.
I know only the scene within the gourd’s heaven and earth,
Who recalls the mortal world’s cyclical years?
Should you ask where my trace returns,
Drunk, I point afar to the edge of white clouds.

**Nine Years Facing the Wall**

Nine years facing the wall, nurturing the spirit’s form,
Silent and dim, as in self-refinement.
Unbound, unconstrained—freedom attained,
Following conditions, knowing when to cease.
The heart shines with the sun and moon’s great radiance,
I and heaven-and-earth stand as inner and outer.

**Shattering the Void**

Shattering the void is no trifling matter,
Gathering the six directions into a millet grain.

**Exchanging the Cauldron and Dividing the Embryo**
Reinstalling the furnace and cauldron, establishing Kun and Qian,
With skillful hands, the elixir is moved into the upper field.
Virtue exalted, the spirit advances further,
The void pulverized, the method boundless.
From now on, the discarded returns to form,
Hereafter, the divided embryo enters the mystery again.
Children nurture grandchildren, grandchildren nurture sons,
Old man and old woman ascend as immortals together.

**Transforming the Mechanism to Communicate with the Spirit**
Nurturing the great-grandchild until gradually grown,
A flourishing lineage surpasses ancestors with wise planning.
Last night by lamplight, a fine match was made,
Today in the hall, a brilliant hero is born.
Each child stands like a jade tree,
Their immortal descendants cluster like golden stalks.
A company surpassing linked jade disks,
Tax-free fertile fields tilled only by oneself.

**Ninefold Spiritual Transformation**
Ninefold cinnabar elixir, years deep,
Nurturing the relic that ghosts and gods revere.
A furnace of white snow, pure as jade,
A cauldron of yellow sprouts, finer than gold.
Once seen, phoenixes dance with simurghs,
Behold tigers roaring and dragons chanting.
The five metals and eight stones all become treasures,
Refining the celestial origin to ascend with one’s dwelling.

**Cultivating the Celestial Origin**
Who knows the grade of the celestial elixir?
Born from non-being, rare in the world.
Heaven and earth as the furnace, true creation,
Yin and yang as the medicine, naturally subtle.
The chicken that eats becomes a crane, soaring through blue clouds,
The dog that feeds becomes a dragon, flying in broad daylight.
Only here is the ultimate in loftiness and wonder,
Permitting you to join hands and return together.

**Carefree and Unfettered**
The Daoist has long since stilled ears and eyes,
Carefree and unconstrained, free from bonds.
At dawn, rising with the sun at Fusang,
At dusk, lodging at the cloud’s edge on Kunlun.
How many years since the blue ox crossed the pass?
This Dao lies clearly before one’s eyes.
Last night, after three refrains on the jade zither,
The wind chilled the sky, the moon shone bright.

**Attaining the Dao and Delivering Others**
Twin iron flutes blow through the dawn mist,
Meeting again after so many years.
Once entrusted with the affairs of non-action beyond the world,
Now inscribed at the brush’s tip, never to be fully conveyed.
A few white hairs—you have grown old,
While I have ascended the blue clouds several times.
The world’s thorough inquiry ends only thus—
Why not roam together and return to the grotto-heaven?

**Summarizing Inner Work**
With pure and still body and mind, refine the inner medicine,
Cultivate qi and blood to restore youthful bearing.
Borrowing the lead cauldron to seek the true seed,
Infusing my mortal frame into the sage’s foundation.
Ten months of gestation with gentle fire,
Nine years facing the wall, nurturing the spirit-child.
Chang’e most loves the child’s youth,
Night after night, pipes and songs feast at the Jade Pool.

**Summarizing Outer Work**
True lead and true mercury unite as husband and wife,
Their mutual joy produces a child.
The young son grows up and leaves the ancestral estate,
The great-grandson takes charge, building a new foundation.
Expanding the family’s fortunes into three enterprises,
Grandly displaying the ninth branch of the lineage.
A room piled with gold—what is there to envy?
Behold the ascent of the entire household to the Jasper Pool.

**Ode to the Primordial Cauldron**
Whose daughter is this fourteen-year-old girl?
At her brows, a radiant glow.
All crave lust and desire,
I see her as my true mother.
A speck of spiritual elixir penetrates,
Her whole body exudes fragrant sweat.
In an instant, she dries my mercury,
Transforming my bones into pure yang.

**Twenty-Four Poems on the Golden Elixir**
*(These twenty-four poems on the Golden Elixir correspond to the twenty-four solar terms.)*

Luzhou’s Liao Fusheng, in his pirated edition, plagiarized for fame, once compiled ancient immortal poems into a collection titled *Awakening the Dao with Elegant Words*. He omitted the names of the perfected ones in most cases, attempting to pass them off as his own work—precisely what Master Zhengfeng called *"a ghost’s scheme of miserly greed stealing the mysterious Dao."* Now, following the authentic version of Immortal Wang, corrections have been made to restore the original. May those who love the Dao not be led astray.

Gathering the primordial to refine the later heaven,
The two qi circulate, sharing a common root.
To know the formed originates from the formless,
One must recognize the first and last crescents.
In the vast, dim moment when heaven and earth were dividing,
Before the dark parents were born.
Ingesting it, one remains in chaos like a dream,
Transforming into an infant with a lifespan of ten thousand years.

The moon itself has no light, borrowing the sun’s glow,
Each month from new moon to full, yin and yang are fixed.
The toad and crow unite in true essence,
The Oxherd and Weaver Girl meet in the boundless.
Naturally, the soul responds to the sacred spirit,
While heaven endures and earth lasts long.
If the student grasps the mystery within,
Their name will hang high in the Purple Palace, fragrant for ages.

Seven days of yang descend the Magpie Bridge,
The couple on the bridge roam freely.
Reversing the sea’s waters to flow into the Celestial Valley,
Inverting the sail to steer the Dipper’s handle.
Holding heaven and earth, dividing creation,
Relying on the years and months to traverse the cycle.
The immortal’s hands often do thus—
How could they contend with the petty with mere words!

The bellows blow with the wind of Xun,
Drawing Kun’s fire from the primordial chaos.
Slowly lifting it to Kunlun’s peak,
Gradually swallowing it back into the earthen crucible.
Lead and mercury unite to form the supreme treasure,
Spirit and essence congeal into an infant.
When it leaps beyond heaven and earth,
It no longer belongs to the turning of the celestial sphere.

Installing the furnace and establishing the cauldron to refine the golden elixir,
Water fears drying, fire fears cold.
Before forging, guard it constantly,
In the stages of *tun* and *meng*, watch diligently.
Drawing lead and adding mercury must be tight,
Beware of danger, do not relax.
A hair’s difference, and the work fails,
Abandoning halfway makes restarting difficult.

Dragon ascends, tiger descends, turning the river chariot,
Red fire captures and refines white sand.
The two qi congeal the embryo, lead naturally diminishes,
The three flowers gather at the crown, mercury returns and increases.
Opening the furnace, stir gently to form stalactites,
Raising the cauldron, know it is like horse’s teeth.
Grasp both substances without letting go,
Releasing them loses the beautiful golden flower.

Gathering from Kun’s earth where water and metal abound,
Planting in Qian’s home, entering the River of Love.
Yang fire and yin talismans follow advance and retreat,
Lead dragon and mercury tiger naturally harmonize.
Nectar collects in the east,
Wine intoxicates in the west with fine silk.
Only with utmost sincerity and diligent care,
After ten months of gestation, the embryo transforms into a blue maiden.

Seizing a speck of heaven and earth’s essence,
Yin and yang unite and naturally form.

Husband and wife unite to gather the three clans,
Wu and Ji intersect to cluster the five phases.
At new and full moons, the stirring and obscuring—chicken and rabbit leap,
At dark and crescent moons, the waning and waxing—tiger and dragon contend.
Heaven and earth are gathered within the mysterious pass,
The river chariot revolves with thunderous sound.
Within the body, water and fire are yin and yang,
The two qi mutually embrace and transform into purple light.
Daily, the ambrosial elixir extends life’s wine,
Hourly, one swallows and gulps the returning-soul nectar.
This mystery is not for the mediocre to know,
The great medicine must be tasted by the resolute.
When the nine revolutions are complete, return to the Great Beginning,
Earth’s softness is refined away, transforming into Heaven’s hardness.
Fire’s nature blazes, water’s nature flows,
The river chariot’s conveyance naturally cycles.
A fragment of Kunlun jade is priceless,
A luminous pearl of the vast sea is cast in darkness.
Samādhi first arises from below Li,
A single talisman first floats from within Kan.
Who can fathom one’s own subtle signs?
Do not broach the subject before others.
To cultivate immortality, one must cultivate Heavenly Immortality,
Observe carefully the divine elixir of golden liquid.
Add in the Li palace, withdraw from Kan,
Entrust to Dui’s position, plant in Qian.
Life and death are settled—not by spirit or qi,
But by the work on nature and destiny in mercury and lead.
In the world, those who chatter of the Dao—
Can ordinary folk grasp this true essence?
Refining the self to seek the real is not difficult,
First capture the rabbit’s marrow to pair with the crow’s liver.
Lead the dragon to the tiger, return to the root cavity,
Restrain mercury, cast lead into the gate of reviving life.
Golden qi comes and goes, passing through the spine,
The river chariot conveys upward to the mud-pill palace.
Husband and wife together enter the Yellow Dame’s abode,
Fire and timing harmonized, the elixir naturally forms.
Opening and closing, Heaven and Earth take the shape of bellows,
Stirring and obscuring—breathing the essence of Kan and Li.
The cauldron harmonizes the four images, true lead descends,
The furnace prepares the three talents, wondrous mercury arises.
One existence and two non-existences transform together,
Two non-existences and one existence mutually complete.
If one wishes to know the marvel within the mystery,
Carefully discuss the pairing with the blue maiden.
The central palace’s Wu and Ji know their own resonance,
Two substances, the matchmaker brings, share one heart.
The maiden of mercury blows the flute without holes,
The lord of metal cradles the zither without strings.
Deep and dense—who can fathom?
Vast and obscure—who can seek?
Once the returning elixir is accomplished,
All the earth shall be turned to gold.
The gentle lead cauldron permeates the curtains,
Recognize the living midnight hour within the body.
At the tiger’s roar, swiftly gather,
At the dragon’s first cry, urgently act.
Guarding the city, wild battles turn heaven and earth,
Entering the chamber, beware danger—Kan and Li alternate.
Seizing the round essence of tortoise and phoenix,
I invite you to partake and ascend to the Jasper Pool.
Enter the chamber with an empty mind to refine the great elixir,
The divine work’s wondrous use is not difficult.
Able to perceive Heaven’s craft and partake of primordial qi,
Understanding how to drink the knife’s edge and seize the purple pellet.
At new and full moons, talismans arrive—the three clans unite,
At dark and crescent moons, fire retreats—the five phases cluster.
Even if Chang’e flees to the moon’s cave,
How can she compare to the blue maiden riding the colored phoenix?
Mercury within wood, gold within water,
Do not idly seek in Li’s palace or Kan’s position.
Only by distinguishing host and guest in Qian and Kun,
And relying on dragon and tiger to determine rising and sinking,
Can metal and wood form the three clans,
Thus enabling husband and wife to share one heart.
Returning to the courtyard, they gather and meet,
The Yellow Dame as matchmaker is their confidant.
The true furnace, true cauldron reveal true mechanism,
Gathering the medicine must rely on the hour of Hai’s end.
The lead mother’s misty radiance stirs,
The golden embryo leaps as fire approaches.
Do not forget to regulate the breath and true rest,
Simply guard emptiness and revolve Kan and Li.
In battle, do not lightly release the enemy,
Be vigilant and cautious, ever on guard.
When the ten months’ work is complete, creation is firm,
If fire is added further, the elixir will be harmed.
In the immortal’s chamber, qi and blood are wholly forgotten,
The precious tripod and golden furnace need not be watched.
Facing the wall for nine years, the form sheds its husk,
The body transcends the three realms, sprouting wings.
Only because the millet grain was swallowed and returned to the belly,
The work overflows, complete—riding the phoenix.
Above, swallow the two crescents,
Step by step, guard and enter the jade field.
Coming and going, guest returns to host,
Husband and wife, wife and husband—reversed and harmonized.
Forming the elixir, one rejoices at the infant’s sign,
Emerging from the husk depends entirely on the holy mother.
Roam near and far, observe the four directions,
East and west, south and north—freely revolve.
Concealing brilliance, hiding traces in the red dust,
With action, who knows the marvel grows ever more real?
Taming tiger and subduing dragon requires mingling with the world,
Transcending the ordinary to enter sagehood startles all.
Deep and secret—cultivating the elixir’s way,
Bright and clear—manifesting the divine.
The *Mirror of Medicines* reveals all mysteries,
By this, ancients and moderns reach the celestial ford.
*The Golden Cinnabar*, *Triplex Unity*, and *Pointing to the Mystery*,
*The Emerald Void*—nature, destiny, loyalty, and immortality.
The *Precious Writ of the Yin Talisman* exceeds three hundred,
The *Sacred Text of the Dao and Virtue* spans five thousand.
In the *Mirror of Entering Medicines*, the bellows is expounded,
Within the *Awakening to Reality*, the fish-trap and rabbit-snare are explored.
The golden elixir’s urgent admonitions,
All discuss the prior and posterior crescents.
The work of fire and timing is fundamentally natural,
One who masters this mystery is a divine immortal.
The five phases cluster, stealing from Heaven and Earth,
The eight trigrams cycle, becoming sages and worthies.
In the crucible of creation, the sun and moon are refined,
Within the cauldron of Qian and Kun, the golden lotus is born.
If one grasps this subtle principle,
Follow me in flight to pay homage before the Emperor.
Reverently bow to the Star Lords,
Prostrate to the stars and constellations, guarding one’s body.
The twenty-eight lunar mansions all shine brightly,
The three hundred sixty degrees are fully arrayed.
The highest sages can gather years, months, and days,
The central palace preserves and unites qi and spirit.
Their illumination grants long life,
Their concealment renews like the two luminaries.
*Eight Poems on the Great Elixir*, inscribed in the Wudang Daoist chamber for disciples:

Cultivating the Dao, refining the real, departing the world’s dust,
Roaming clouds and waters, delighting in Heaven’s truth.
The numinous medicine within the body is not metal or stone,
The divine sand within the belly is not mercury!
Gathering and refining depend on the sun and moon,
Refining and heating—fire and timing match geng and shen.
The Yellow Dame as matchmaker unites the three families,
Drinking wine, admiring flowers—spring fills the land.
Gather the lead from another’s home,
Seize essence, refine qi, replenish the prior Heaven.
The prior crescent’s eight ounces, the posterior crescent’s eight,
When the inner medicine returns, the outer medicine returns.
The purple palace and mysterious chamber drip precious dew,
The yellow sprout and white snow transform into the golden toad.

The immortal’s wondrous work ever thus:
In fire, one may plant the nine-jointed lotus.
First barrier, middle barrier, and last barrier,
Lower field, middle field, and upper field—
Layers originally divided in perfect order,
Fire-work must follow the method with utmost care.
The chamber’s windows brighten by the third watch,
Day and night, the nine cauldrons glow crimson.
Civil and martial, yin and yang diligently refined,
Ten thousand apertures open to face Heaven.
The inner workings I know for myself—
Who has glimpsed such profound and wondrous mystery?

First, seek the dragon and tiger locked in battle,
Then behold the tortoise and snake singing in harmony.
Heaven and Earth inverted to observe fortune and adversity,
Fire talismans rise and cease in the Void and Danger.
Southern stars and Northern Dipper shine fore and aft,
Sun and moon, crow and toad, fly to and fro.

The great Dao of cultivating truth is the ancestor of Heaven and Earth,
Gathering yin and yang to master the work of creation.
To restrain the celestial soul and give birth to the White Tiger,
One must capture the earthly spirit to produce the Azure Dragon.
Circulating the supreme treasure to unite at the center,
Transforming the yang spirit to ascend to the upper palace.
A single qi condenses into one grain of elixir—
If one can swallow it, their countenance becomes youthful.

Daoist methods and side doors number in the thousands,
Yet without knowing the firing times, all is in vain.
First delve into the wondrous principles to attain true awakening,
Then bow to an enlightened teacher to receive the oral transmission.
To unite the three families in harmony,
Rely solely on the steadfastness of the Dao-heart.

Morning and night, temper the spirit and qi,
Refining until the true spirit coalesces and ascends to the Nine Heavens.
To seek truth, one must recognize the aperture of emptiness—
The work lies solely in where the intent arrives.
Coming and going, reversing and refining yin and yang,
Rising and descending, Kan and Li in inversion.
Vaguely, indistinctly, the Supreme Ultimate arises,
Faintly, obscurely, the infant takes form.
Exiting the mysterious and entering the feminine comes naturally,
As if forgotten, as if preserved—guarding the furnace and hearth.

Knowing the prior to refine the golden elixir,
If the fire cools or the water dries, the work is incomplete.
Supreme virtue, non-action, perfects the sage,
Lesser work, effort, lies in the Zhou Tian.
When the first yang stirs, Heaven and Earth are revealed,
When the two treasures unite, buddhas and immortals are born.
Planting flowers in the moon lasts but a moment,
Yet the toad’s radiance emerges, illuminating the western land.

*Jade Flower Poem*
Jade branches and trees belong to the immortals,
Such flowers unknown in the mortal world.
Their purity untouched by common rain and dew,
Their lofty bearing ever veiled in ancient mist and rosy clouds.
Ageless through the years, never growing old,
Peerless in the world—let none boast idly.
I would pluck them to return to Heaven,
Planning to borrow the divine raft from Bo Wang.

*Seven Absolute Quatrains*
The true heart vast and boundless,
Infinite immortals arise from within.
Mortals cling to their petty forms,
Yet none recognize the single pearl of mystery!

Again:
Buddha’s seal points to emptiness as awakening,
Dan Yang’s secret breaks the "nothing" to reveal "something."
Seize the original, primal point of truth,
And for myriad ages, the body shall not decay.

Again:
Flowing upstream straight to Penglai,
Scattering sweet springs to moisten the nine realms.
From this, the elixir field receives moisture,
And golden sprouts bloom everywhere at once.

Again:
Years, months, days, and hours are but empty marks,
Hexagrams, lines, and weights—mere fragments.
If one grasps the unbroken thread of intent,
It is precisely the time of neither forgetting nor forcing.

Again:
The great medicine is but a single pill,
Yet it must seek its kindred to rejoice in union.
If mortals ask for the secret of longevity,
First seek the dual elixirs of yin and yang.

*Essential Mysteries, Part Three*
Ascending the high terrace—following the *Cantong Qi*’s line,
*"Close the eyes and ascend the high terrace,"*
as if breaking through the profound mystery,
making the heart and eyes bright,
like ascending a high terrace to see all near and far.
This tune takes its name therefrom.

The wondrous workings of the golden elixir are hard to express,
Who can discern the subtle principles of the mysterious and minute?
Fortunately, meeting an enlightened teacher’s guidance,
One breaks through the sky within the water.

First, they teach us to guard the mysterious pass,
Sit cross-legged to harmonize spirit, principle, and qi,
Banish thoughts, seal the senses, and lower the eyelids.
Next, they teach us to stir the wind of Xun,
Circulate water and fire,
Guard the true essence,
Preserve the original yang,
And turn the celestial gate.

Then one sees the Yellow River’s waters surging upstream,
From the Bubbling Spring,
Through the Tailbone Pass,
To the Spine Bridge,
Ascending to the Mud Pill Palace.
Passing the Hall of Light,
Entering the Flower Pool,
The divine water gradually rises,
Descending the Towering Pavilion,
Entering the Crimson Palace,
Until reaching the elixir field.
This is the work of laying the foundation and refining the self—
Henceforth, one dwells in the world to prolong life.
This is the lesser returning elixir’s work.

If one further seeks the supreme path of ascension,
They must once more establish the furnace and set up the cauldron,
Gathering the prior Heaven to match the posterior Heaven.
At midnight and noon, focus on the firing times,
At dawn and dusk, bathe the golden elixir.
They further teach us first to understand the mechanism of Heaven and Earth,
Then to distinguish yin and yang.
Heaven exists only with the Mother,
Without the Mother, there is no Heaven—
This is the root of the great Dao.

Count the Zhou Tian from the beginning,
Invert and arrange Qian and Kun.
Diligently refine the posterior Heaven,
Seize the prior Heaven to become a sage or immortal.

I have already bowed to an enlightened teacher,
Heart to heart, mouth to mouth, the transmission received.
When laying the foundation, first clarify the bellows and key,
When refining the self, use only true lead.
The fullness within Kan is taken from Li,
The emptiness within Li is filled by Kan’s return.
In reversal, the immortal dragon swallows the tiger’s marrow,
In sequence, the mortal tiger seizes the dragon’s saliva.

What delights is the Wood Dragon concealing mercury,
What is cherished is the Metal Tiger spitting lead.
The moon’s fullness depends on the oral formula,
The midnight hour’s wonder lies in the heart’s transmission.
Gathering the prior Heaven’s work relies entirely on Wu and Ji,
Seizing the posterior Heaven’s qi begins with the dragon and tiger’s first crescent.
Azure Dragon and White Tiger locked in battle,
Jade Hare and Golden Horse grappling in one place.

Beware only of lacking the sword of wisdom within,
Fear only being unable to pull the boat at the rapids’ edge.
Wait only for the Yellow Dame’s matchmaking,
Await only the Maiden’s lotus blossoming.

This matter is hard to speak of—
Within five thousand days, you must calculate,
In thirty hours, silently revolve.
Before midnight and after noon, observe clearly:
Lead-yang not yet stirred,
Gui appears before,
True lead, true yang follow behind.
When the medicine arrives at the furnace,
Do not be negligent at this moment—
Swiftly seize and draw it into the pass,
Then apply the six hundred measures of withdrawal and addition.

In the tenth month, the embryo is complete, the infant appears,
